intro: Pedicularis limprichtii, commonly known as the Limpricht's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes over 450 species of flowering plants commonly referred to as louseworts. This particular species is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from purple to pink, and it typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Pedicularis limprichtii is often found in rocky soils and is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants.
